intro: Nepeta turcica, commonly known as Turkish catmint, is a perennial herb native to the mountains of Turkey and the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a serrated margin. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, producing small, tubular blooms in shades of blue, purple, or white. Nepeta turcica is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as an ornamental plant in gardens.
